metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9501 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
In ImageMagick 7.0.5-7 Q16, an assertion failure was found in the function LockSemaphoreInfo, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9501` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> reproducer in github report mdeslaur> This is 0068-1-3-CVE-2017-9501-Fixed-incorrect-call-to-DestroyIma.patch and 0069-2-3-CVE-2017-9501-Avoid-an-off-by-one-error.patch and 0070-3-3-CVE-2017-9501-Avoid-an-off-by-one-error.patch

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8').
